description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Sustainable Local Development Project

Objectives for Serbia: USAID’s Sustainable Local Development Project (SLDP) is a six-year initiative supporting local governments, businesses and civil society to increase economic growth through Inter-Municipal Cooperation (IMC). The project’s core activities are focused on supporting inter-municipal partners to add jobs and reduce unemployment in 32 municipalities clustered in eight regions. Assisting IMC partners to add jobs by supporting private sector expansion; Strengthening public administration to enable inter-municipal business growth and investments; Integrating youth into local economies.

description.narrative: Improve policies, laws, regulations, and administrative practices affecting the private sector. Includes reducing barriers to competition and unwarranted distortions to market prices; reducing policy and regulatory barriers to establishing, operating, and closing businesses; strengthening the legal framework surrounding property rights that is fair to both men and women, contract enforcement, and dispute resolution, along with the administration of those laws; reducing incentives for corruption and promoting transparent business practices; strengthening the legal framework surrounding intellectual property rights; and improving laws and regulations affecting the creation, dissemination, and use of technology. It also includes improving policies and regulations affecting technology choices and production behaviors with environmental impacts; and improving policies, laws, and regulations affecting hiring and firing of workers, wages, working conditions, and collective bargaining. Includes support for specific improvements as well as efforts to strengthen the institutions that contribute to designing and implementing further improvements.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Development Credit Authority, United States
Development Credit Authority, United States

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: The PSD project is strengthening private sector firms in 12 municipalities in the economically devastated regions of South and Southwest Serbia. The project is being implemented by the National Agency for Regional Development (NARD)through its network of Regional Development Agencies (RDAs)to help growth-oriented companies and business clusters increase sales and exports and create jobs. This is the first Government-to-Government activity signed by USAID Serbia.

Objectives for Serbia: Through PSD, USAID provides DAS and the RDAs assistance that improves their program management, monitoring and evaluation, and market assessment capabilities. This in turn allows DAS and the RDAs to support private sector development by working with businesses in high-potential sectors, helping the businesses to: Understand and serve local/regional markets better; Improve the quality of existing and traditional products, as well as develop new ones; Lower their cost of production; Broaden the network of suppliers, increasing the profitability and size of their operations.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: (Serbia): The Activity reinforces collective action to increase government accountability and decrease corruption by supporting citizen-driven activities to grow and strengthen a country-wide network of civil society organizations, grassroots organizations, activists, and journalists who advocate for effective anti-corruption measures and greater government accountability. Through bolstering citizen-driven demand for accountable and responsive government institutions, thus enabling democratic environment where citizens feel empowered and have the confidence to influence public decision-making, the project will accomplish the following: 1) To empower local agents of change (CSOs, active citizens, grassroots, journalists) in raising demand for effective implementation of anti-corruption measures and greater government accountability, and 2) To restore citizens' trust in the effectiveness of civic engagement. Additionally as Objective 3, the Activity includes citizen driven anti-corruption efforts in the election process through which support has been granted to long-standing domestic and grassroot efforts to combat corrupt electoral practices and improve the transparency and integrity of the electoral process by supporting citizen oversight of the election process, thus increasing Serbia's commitment to democratic values.

description.narrative: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

description.narrative: The Strategic Advocacy Approaches project is a 4.5-year initiative intended to improve cooperation between citizens, civil society and government on identified issues of concern, therefore strengthening participatory democracy in Serbia. The project will help improve the capacity of Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) to strategically implement advocacy initiatives, engage citizens and mobilize local resources. The project will also help advance the enabling environment for advocacy in Serbia.

title.narrative: Media Initiatives and Partnerships Support Program

description.narrative: The goal of MIPS is to assist Serbian citizens to navigate a complex media and information landscape in order to effectively participate in modern economic and democratic life. MIPS address the USAID/Serbia Mission Development Objective I, "Accountability of Key Democratic Institutions Strengthened" of the USAID/Serbia CDCS. It specifically accomplishes this by supporting Intermediate Result IR 1.1 Government Institutions More Responsive to Citizens, and Sub-JR 1.1.3 "Media Independence and Professionalism Improved."

description.narrative: Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations.

description.narrative: Provide mediums (media, civil society organizations, advocacy groups/ associations) through which citizens can freely organize, advocate, and communicate with their government and with each other; strengthen a democratic political culture that values citizen and civic engagement, tolerance, and respect for human rights; empower citizens to participate in decision-making on matters affecting them; and mobilize constituencies to advocate for political reform, good governance, and strengthened democratic institutions and processes.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for Europe, Eurasia and Central Asia (AEECA)
Assistance for Europe, Eurasia and Central Asia (AEECA)

description.narrative: (Serbia): USAID's Serbia Innovates Activity focuses on solving low connectivity density and low collaboration within Serbia's innovation ecosystem; short innovation value chains; a lack of cooperation between innovative and traditional companies; lack of cooperation between innovative companies and financial institutions; and lack of financing options for these companies in the early stage of their development. The activity uses the "supercluster model" adjusted to the Serbian context. In the first six months of the activity, the implementer undertook extensive research on eight different domains within the economy: artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, high-technology agricultural production, gaming industry, solutions for smart environment, eco-smart energy sources, advanced materials and advanced production processes, and biotechnology. Through the research, they narrowed it down to the four most promising ones for focus: web3 and blockchain technologies; gaming and virtual reality; advanced solutions in medical technology and biotechnology, and high technology in agriculture and the food industry. The activity will build out the "superclusters"; i.e., the related networks to include the business producers, academia, government, and consumers, to accelerate economic potential of each domain. Superclusters apply principles of knowledge-based economic growth that are embraced in both the US and EU. As such, the activity will produce good platforms for cooperation with education institutions and start-up support services from the EU and US. This activity supports the USG's priority to grow economic opportunities and prosperity. It supports Embassy ICS Mission Objective 2.1 "Broad-Based, Inclusive, and Sustainable Economic Growth..." In line with USAID's pre-obligation requirement standards, the Mission verifies that all assistance activities do not have an adverse economic effect on the United States.

description.narrative: (Serbia): USAID's Venture an Idea Activity focuses on building the entrepreneurial mindset of younger generations and accelerating Serbia's innovation-driven development. There have been important developments both in terms of Serbian government reforms to spur on innovation but also increased investment from the private sector. However, success stories of Serbia's innovative businesses in the global context remain outliers. This activity looks at younger generations to increase the number of entrepreneurs and/or startup founders. The activity has four main objectives: 1) to embed and develop an entrepreneurial mindset in younger generations to start their own businesses, develop technology and build innovative business models; 2) to pilot/demonstrate co-creation of innovative products and services in order to increase their commercialization and boost creativity within targeted groups; 3) to support selected startups to increase their global reach; and 4) to improve connections between business and academia. This activity supports the USG's priority to grow economic opportunities and prosperity. It supports ICS Mission Objective 2.1 "Broad-Based, Inclusive, and Sustainable Economic Growth Accelerated, Including Through Improved Access to U.S. and European Finance and an Improved Ecosystem for the Knowledge-Based Economy." In line with USAID's pre-obligation requirement standards, the Mission verifies that all assistance activities do not have an adverse economic effect on the United States.

description.narrative: The development challenges this project addresses relate to limited financial and operative means of the Republic of Serbia for COVID-19 prevention and control, including for undertaking a massive immunization process in as short a timespan as possible, in order to secure herd immunity against the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a challenge practically all countries in the world are facing now, attempting to secure means to put in place ad hoc measures, going beyond typical strategies, to protect their citizens from the spread of COVID-19 and organize and implement a massive immunization process. Reaching herd immunity means an end to the pandemic, saving of lives and preservation of health, revival of economies, return to educational, cultural, sports and other social activities. Countries, including the Republic of Serbia, are in a race against time, investing into stronger health systems, preventive measures and vaccination of their population.

description.narrative: USAID's Media Innovation Activity supports independent media development in Serbia, with emphasis on increased public access to relevant and accurate information; increased competitiveness of Serbian independent media and information industry stakeholders; improved access to investment capital and development finance; and application of cutting-edge technological solutions. The activity works with a wide range of stakeholders, including but not limited to professional media, digital entrepreneurs and services providers, financial sector, and others that are critical for public access to accurate information. To counter malign foreign influences and disinformation campaigns, programs will seek to ensure the long-term sustainability of the independent media as technology rapidly evolves (e.g. Internet of Things and 5G) to gain a competitive edge. The activity will facilitate the establishment of a stand-alone investment fund (a self-sustaining entity with the participation of other donors and/or private capital) to provide sustainable, long-term investment for professional independent media and other participants in the media and information sector who are critical for public access to accurate information. The activity will also work to improve the ability of citizens to discern good information from disinformation. This activity supports the USG's priority to renew and champion democracy and human rights and the Embassy ICS Mission Objective 1.2 Accountability of Essential Democratic Institutions Strengthened; and 100% of funding goes toward CAATSA Goal 5.

description.narrative: (Serbia): SMEs play a significant role in driving Serbia's economy, but face challenges in growing further. USAID's Big Small Businesses Activity will: (a) improve productivity and profitability of SMEs through enhanced management and modernization; (b) expand SME exports through improved market alignment and adaptations; and (c) increase SMEs utilization of financing instruments. The activity will focus in sectors that present export market opportunity and the potential for inclusive growth in underdeveloped regions of the country. Those sectors are Agriculture and Food and Equipment and Machinery, with cross-sectoral programming on digital development, green growth, and human capacity development to increase opportunities for women and youth. The activity will help Serbian SMEs become more aligned with the EU, US, and other higher-value markets. In doing so, it will seek to incorporate best practices, models, and technology from developed countries, such as the US, including seeking opportunities for collaboration among educational institutions. This activity supports the USG's priorities to grow economic opportunities and prosperity and champion equity and inclusion. It supports ICS Mission Objective 2.1 "Broad-Based, Inclusive, and Sustainable Economic Growth Accelerated, Including Through Improved Access to U.S. and European Finance and an Improved Ecosystem for the Knowledge-Based Economy."

description.narrative: (Serbia): To secure Serbia's sustainable development, USAID's Together for the Environment activity will improve environmental and biodiversity protection by building the capacity of relevant actors, piloting sustainable financing mechanisms, and increasing citizen engagement in oversight and decision making related to natural resources and biodiversity protection. The activity supports the USG's priorities to promote climate security and resilience and to renew and champion democracy and human rights. It also supports USAID's Climate Strategy and ICS Mission Objective 3.1 "Serbia Strengthens Public Health and Environmental Protection Institutions and Takes Concrete Steps to Address Climate Change."

title.narrative: Evaluating the Impact of Economic Growth Programming in Serbia

description.narrative: impact evaluation of the sme development activity serbias economy has a high potential for sustained growth, and small and medium enterprises (smes) could be the key to that progress. however, recent trends show that serbias productivity is currently only about half of that of the u.s., germany, and other western economies. past economic growth programs in serbia have delivered results but without a rigorous evaluation, it is challenging to understand which interventions are most effective..

title.narrative: Let’s Go Out – Let’s Work Together Activity

description.narrative: (Serbia): This activity will look to advance equity and economic opportunity for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and intersex (LGBTQI+) people, by promoting economic inclusion, advancement, and related empowerment of LGBTQI+ people in the Serbian marketplace. The activity will develop workplace programs directly with businesses to address internal systems that potentially inhibit hiring, retention and promotion of LGBTQI+ employees and provide training and capacity-building for hiring professionals, managers and staff on diversity fundamentals, bias, and principles of inclusion that contribute to a respectful, safe, and inclusive work environment and enhances retention. This activity will have significant interaction with the private sector and supports the USG's priorities to promote equity and inclusion and to grow economic opportunities and prosperity. It supports ICS Mission Objective 2.1 "Broad-Based, Inclusive, and Sustainable Economic Growth Accelerated, Including Through Improved Access to U.S. and European Finance and an Improved Ecosystem for the Knowledge-Based Economy."

description.narrative: The activity improves citizen understanding of and access to the justice system. It utilizes a people-centered justice approach to make the institutions, services, and actors that comprise the justice system more user-friendly, problem-solving, and data-driven. The activity also focuses especially on legal services for survivors of gender-based violence. Additionally, the activity improves court and related services, in terms of quality and efficiency, and identifies obstacles to access, for both users and providers. Finally, the activity will improve coordination processes among stakeholders to ensure equal justice to all. It supports JRS Goal 4 Uphold Western Democratic Principles and Institutions, Objective 4.1 Strengthen respect for rule of law...; the Embassy ICS Mission Objective 1.2 Accountability of Essential Democratic Institutions Strengthened; and 100% of funding goes toward CAATSA Goal 2 Rule of Law.

description.narrative: USAID/Serbia aims to support the establishment of an investment vehicle that will focus on financing innovative products and services in the media, information, and communications sectors in the west balkans region. To do so, USAID will issue a grant to support a fund that will make investments in products and services that directly or indirectly increase citizens ability to access information or increase critical thinking skills with a focus on, but not exclusively, to support: a) small and medium-sized enterprises; new and existing companies that provide media, information and communications services; b) industry stakeholders, including entrepreneurs, that develop supporting technological infrastructure and architecture, or increase innovation in the media, information and technology sphere.

title.narrative: Economic Empowerment of Women in Serbia Activity.

description.narrative: The She Knows project will also promote and improve diversity, equity, and inclusion practices in the business community. A nationwide baseline assessment on employment gender gaps that we carried out, shows that despite companies promoting gender equality, challenges persist, and implementing measures do not guarantee effectiveness. To benefit both women and companies, companies need to continuously monitor gender equality indicators and provide stronger leadership for inclusive and diverse working environments and work-life balance initiatives, said Stefan Lazarevi, President of AmCham.

description.narrative: Improve policies, laws, regulations, and administrative practices affecting the private sector. Includes reducing barriers to competition and unwarranted distortions to market prices; reducing policy and regulatory barriers to establishing, operating, and closing businesses; strengthening the legal framework surrounding property rights that is fair to both men and women, contract enforcement, and dispute resolution, along with the administration of those laws; reducing incentives for corruption and promoting transparent business practices; strengthening the legal framework surrounding intellectual property rights; and improving laws and regulations affecting the creation, dissemination, and use of technology. It also includes improving policies and regulations affecting technology choices and production behaviors with environmental impacts; and improving policies, laws, and regulations affecting hiring and firing of workers, wages, working conditions, and collective bargaining. Includes support for specific improvements as well as efforts to strengthen the institutions that contribute to designing and implementing further improvements.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: The Serbia Media Assistance Program, funded by USAID, supports independent and self-sustainable Serbian media through a whole station approach that looks across business and editorial functions while tapping other program resources like journalism training and subgrant funding.

Objectives for Serbia: The program is designed around three main objectives: Provide outlets and media partners with more substantial and stable resources to operate as viable enterprises. Strengthen the ability of content producers to engage wider audiences and expand reach across the region. Foster stronger partnerships to advance solutions on common challenges in the digital space: In-person collaboration is crucial for developing relationships that support cooperation to achieve mutually beneficial goals.

description.narrative: The program aims to enhance the ability of key actors, including the government, political parties, parliament, and civil society, to develop institutional capacity and strengthen relations between institutions within the political environment.

Objectives for Serbia: The USAID Political Process Support in Serbia Project is a five-year program to develop the institutional capacity of political parties, the National Assembly of the Republic of Serbia (NARS), targeted governmental institutions and civil society to advance key reforms, enhance the policy development process, improve accountability, increase civic engagement, and support democratic elections.

description.narrative: Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

The project provides technical assistance, grants and subcontracts.

description.narrative: Encourage and help countries to apply sustainable and efficient fiscal policies, which consist of establishing revenue and expenditure structures and develop management techniques that allow a government to manage the economy through the expansion and contraction of government spending. All support for fiscal policy should be decentralized to the appropriate level of government, and seek to eliminate the potential for corruption.
Objectives for Serbia: The Support to Regulation of Para-fiscal Charges project is a two-year, $372,800 initiative to inventory, monitor, and reduce Serbia's para-fiscal charges.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: The EU's accession requirements include the Copenhagen Criteria, which require countries to have market-oriented economies that can withstand competition. Supporting Serbia's EU accession effort is a U.S. policy priority in Serbia and the Balkans. Through technical assistance and the direct or indirect provision of equipment, this USAID activity will help Serbia integrate with European markets by assisting the food processing sector to invest, upgrade and collaborate to meet EU market demands. Working with fruit and vegetable processing firms and associations and the public sector, the activity will develop value chain capacities and facilitate partnerships among system actors, leveraging advances to improve productivity and competitiveness. Assistance will support Serbian small and medium enterprises (SMEs) within the sector to upgrade and become more competitive in local, regional, and international markets. Additionally, the activity will address access-to-credit constraints that limit SME growth in Serbia's promising food processing industry.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

title.narrative: Rule of Law Project in Serbia

description.narrative: Advancing the rule of law and justice sector reform are top U.S. priorities that are critical to Serbia's democratic and economic development and its aspirations to join the EU. Through technical assistance and the direct or indirect provision of equipment, the activity will support Serbia's development of a new National Judicial Reform Strategy, which will serve as a roadmap for reforms required for EU integration. It will help implement select elements of the new strategy. Assistance will foster the timely and efficient enforcement of judgement and increase the operational efficiency of the State Attorney's Office-both of which are obstacles to strengthening the rule of law in Serbia.

Objectives for Serbia: The USAID Rule of Law (ROL) project is a four-year, $9.8 million project supporting justice sector reforms that enhance the timely delivery of justice for Serbian citizens. The project works with the courts, public enforcement agents and the State Attorney’s Office to increase judicial efficiency, transparency and access to justice. In addition, the project supports a range of initiatives to improve court operations, reduce delays in court proceedings and increase public confidence in the work of the courts. This includes: greater utilization of E-justice tools; more efficient delivery of court documents to reduce trial delays; streamlined court administration; and supporting the work and career path of judicial assistants.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Competitiveness Support Project

Objectives for Serbia: USAID’s Competitiveness Support Project is a two-year direct grant to the National Alliance for Local Economic Development (NALED). The overall objective of the project is to improve the business enabling environment through increased fairness and improved competitiveness and to create inspiring surroundings for business operations. The project activities are based on priorities identified by the private sector and the Government of Serbia (GoS). The project focuses on achieving two key objectives: Increasing public awareness of: the negative effects of the shadow economy, the incentives of moving into the regular economy. Re-developing a brownfield site to serve as a replicable model for the rest of the country.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: The New Beginning

Objectives for Serbia: The activity will focus on regions with the largest numbers of laid-off workers and will motivate them to use their knowledge and resources to start their own business. The experiences of the previous severance programs clearly show that redundant workers have a lack of knowledge about how to start their own businesses and about entrepreneurship. This project will give them an opportunity for a “new beginning” by starting their own business.

description.narrative: Promote peaceful agreement on democratic reform, rules, and frameworks. Promote peaceful, broad-based participation in determining, defining, and negotiating changes to governing structures. Illustrative examples include promoting inclusive consensus-building processes related to peace agreements, national dialogues, referenda on key issues, and constitutional development or reform. Programs are designed to incorporate and support mechanisms that advance conflict mediation, resolution and negotiation of disputes in the context of these processes.

Objectives for Serbia: The Public Private Dialogue project is a four-year, $1.43 million initiative to help build sustainable, effective public-private collaborations between the Government, private sector and civil society in order to improve the business enabling environment and generate more dynamic and sustainable economic growth. The project aims to ensure integration and sustainability of public-private dialogue values and mechanisms.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. title.narrative: Performance Evaluation of the Preparedness, Planning and Economic Security (PPES) Project

description.narrative: IBTCI was contracted to carry out a performance evaluation for USAID/Serbia of the multi-faceted Preparedness Planning and Economic Security Project. The first component (Preparedness Planning) addressed the ability of Serbian municipalities to respond to natural and man-made emergencies, including the potential for large influxes of refugees, while the Economic Security element aimed at strengthening opportunities for youth employment nationwide and at strengthening the abilities of businesses in the highly vulnerable areas. This was done by helping improve operations, marketing, planning, and export among other areas. The Preparedness planning evaluation consisted of strengthening the technical ability of participating municipalities to plan for and respond to emergencies, by advocating improvements in the legislative and regulatory framework surrounding emergency response. The Economic Security element was conducted by evaluating the impact and effectiveness of different types of youth engagement across Serbia.

description.narrative: USAIDs Agribusiness Project is a five-year economic development project aimed at increasing the competitiveness of Serbias agribusiness industry, as measured by increased sales and jobs of assisted companies. The project works in six agricultural sub-sectors: (1) berry fruits; (2) dairy products; (3) herbs & mushrooms; (4) livestock & meat; (5) tree fruits; (6) vegetables. The projects activities are divided into two main components: Increasing Efficiency & Competitiveness and Improving the Enabling Environment for Serbian Agribusinesses.

description.narrative: Program Design and Learning - Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded operating unit wide programs, not for a specific functional objective. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, public outreach, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Funding for similar activities that are directed to specific functional objectives should be entered in the PD&L sub-element of the appropriate program area(s) within that objective.
